block.p: Elizabeth Joy, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard F. Joy of Glen Ridge, N.J., was married yesterday to Peter Horst Conze III, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Conze Jr. of Providence, R.I. The Rev. Carl Hansen performed the ceremony at All Saints' Episcopal Church in Carmel, Calif.

The bride, 28, is a senior financial analyst in Mountain View, Calif., for an interactive-television division of Microsoft. She graduated from Yale and received an M.B.A. from the University of California at Berkeley. Her father is the head of the Federal Defender Division of the Legal Aid Society of New York.

Elizabeth Joy, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard F. Joy of Glen Ridge, N.J., was married yesterday to Peter Horst Conze III, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Conze Jr. of Providence, R.I. The Rev. Carl Hansen performed the ceremony at All Saints' Episcopal Church in Carmel, Calif.

The bride, 28, is a senior financial analyst in Mountain View, Calif., for an interactive-television division of Microsoft. She graduated from Yale and received an M.B.A. from the University of California at Berkeley. Her father is the head of the Federal Defender Division of the Legal Aid Society of New York.

The bridegroom, 30, is a broker in Palo Alto, Calif., for Salomon Smith Barney. He graduated from Georgetown University and received a master's degree in product design from Stanford. His father was until this year the chief financial officer of WebED Inc., a company in Hampton, N.H., that offers online training to teachers and school administrators.
